intro: Critesion magellanicum, commonly known as the Magellanic crite, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, contributing to local biodiversity.
